content: dodogama from monster hunter amigurumi pattern by christina billman materials yarn i used impeccable yarn brand o tan or yellow heather o light blue smoke o medium blue blue moon o dark blue o burnt orange pumpkin o black crochet hook 3 5mm yarn needle notation key us chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet single_crochet# = single_crochet in next # st double_crochet = double_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet st = stitch increase = increase two single_crochet in one st decrease = decrease slip_stitch = slip_stitch magic_ring # = magic_ring with # number of stitches number of stitches in row f/o = finish off blo = back loops only notes single_crochet around before you begin each piece is worked in continuous rounds unless noted otherwise this pattern uses us notation body worked from the bottom to the neck begin with tan yarn 1 magic_ring 6 2 increase around 12 3 single_crochet increase around 4 sc2 increase around 5 sc3 increase around 6 single_crochet around 7 sc4 increase around 8 sc5 increase around 9 single_crochet around 10 single_crochet around 11 sc6 increase around 48 12 single_crochet around 13 single_crochet around change to medium blue yarn 14 single_crochet around change to tan yarn 15 single_crochet around 16 single_crochet around change to medium blue yarn 17 single_crochet around 18 single_crochet around 19 sc7 increase around 20 single_crochet around 21 single_crochet around 22 single_crochet around 23 single_crochet around 24 single_crochet around 25 sc7 decrease around 48 26 sc6 decrease around 27 sc5 decrease around 28 single_crochet around 29 sc4 decrease around stuff body with fiberfill 30 sc3 decrease around 31 sc2 decrease around 32 sc1 decrease around 33 decrease around f/o and hide remaining yarn head worked from the tip of the nose down to the neck begin with medium blue yarn 1 mr6 2 increase around 3 sc1 increase around 4 single_crochet around 5 sc2 increase around 6 single_crochet around 7 sc3 increase around 8 single_crochet around 9 sc4 increase around 10 sc5 increase around 42 11 single_crochet around 12 single_crochet around 13 single_crochet around 14 single_crochet around 15 sc5 decrease around 36 16 sc5 decrease sc1 x6 sc13 30 17 sc3 decrease around 24 f/o leaving a tail for sewing the decrease sc1 x6 section of the head will be the bottom of the chin i would recommend putting a marker there as we sew the head on my original stitch marker ended up being basically at the top of the head see photos you can add safety eyes here if you d like otherwise we will sew eyes on at the end see assembly 3 eyes and eyeballs use photos for reference on placement tail starting at the tip of the tail working up towards the body this pattern is written different than the rest in order to give the tail a bit of a curve begin with orange yarn 1 mr5 2 sc2 increase sc2 3 sc2 increase increase sc2 8 4 sc3 increase sc3 decrease 8 5 sc3 increase increase sc3
